channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Slippery leaves building up in cycle path, 18th November
item.description:
The cycle lane area on London Road at the junction with College Road and Hewlett Road is full of leaves which have been cleared from houses. Theyâ€™re now very slippery and it feels dangerous to try and ride in the cycle lane at this point on the road. Please can these be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, London Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slab outside 34 Bournside Road leaning against tree, 18th November
item.description:
For some bizarre reason the pavement outside our house was repaired but a broken paving slab was left on the grass (now propped up against tree). The slab needs to be collected. This is the SECOND advice of this problem. Last time a photo was sent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Bournside Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole that breaks near side wheels, 18th November
item.description:
Coming down Gloucester Road towards Andoversford, 100m after crossroads and just before bend in the road (no other landmarks nearby). Not driven this road for a while so don't know how long its been there but someone else reported a similar problem in the same location and it has not yet had white paint put around it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Scottish Power Van, 18th November
item.description:
Scottish Power Van in the same spot for 3 weeks, gathering leaves. Beginning to suspect it's been stolen and abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over 10" pothole, 18th November
item.description:
The pothole is full of water. The one opposite was fixed but not this one and its only a few metres away. Tell the contractors to do them properly rather than putting a sticking plaster on it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Vicarage Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester
